code: @Manual{,   title = {gatoRs: gatoRs},   author = {Natalie Patten},   year = {2023},   note = {https://nataliepatten.github.io/gatoRs/, https://github.com/nataliepatten/gatoRs}, }

title: gatoRs
text: Natalie N. Patten, Michelle L. Gaynor, Douglas E. Soltis, Pamela S. Soltis

title: gatoRs
text: gatoRs (Geographic Taxonomic Occurrence R-Based Scrubbing) provides users tools downloading processing biodiversity data.

title: gatoRs
text: download data using gators_download(), need list possible names species (including synonyms), first name list accepted name using species code option GBIF search. also need path name file, including “.csv” ending. Example: Optional parameters include gbif_match idigbio_filter. gbif_match allows search fuzzy matching records scientific name (default, gbif_match = “fuzzy”) search associated species key using GBIF’s backbone taxonomy system (gbif_match = “code”). set TRUE (default, recommended), idigbio_filter fuzzy matches taxonomic columns provided taxon names. filters dataset relevant data. function also generates scientificName, genus, specificEpithet, infraspecificEpithet columns based available data parsing fixes incorrect capitalization species names give data cleaner look. overview returned data summarized table .
code: gators_download(synonyms_list = c("Asclepias curtissii", "Asclepias aceratoides",                                   "Asclepias arenicola", "Oxypteryx arenicola",                                    "Oxypteryx curtissii"),                  newFileName = "base_folder/other_folder/my_file.csv")

title: gatoRs
text: find data needs manually received institution via permit (removed dataset), use needed_records(). Use downloaded data previous step input. receiving data herbaria, manually enter original dataset. Example:

title: gatoRs
text: find data lacking coordinates containing locality information, use need_to_georeference(). Use downloaded data first step input. georeference records manually enter information dataset. Example:

title: gatoRs
text: find data containing scientific names corresponding desired species, use filter_select_name(). Use downloaded data first step input, well synonyms list, accepted name, filter option (exact, fuzzy, interactive). Example:
code: occurrence_records <- filter_select_name(occurrence_records, synonyms_list = c("Asclepias curtissii", "Asclepias aceratoides", "Asclepias arenicola", "Oxypteryx arenicola", "Oxypteryx curtissii"), filter = "interactive", accepted_name = "Asclepias curtissii")

title: gators_download — gators_download
text: function downloads data GBIF iDigBio desired species. Data returned includes: scientificName, genus, specificEpithet, infraspecificEpithet, basisOfRecord, eventDate, institutionCode, collectionCode, collectionID, country, county, stateProvince, locality, latitude, longitude, identificationID, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters, informationWithheld, habitat.

title: gators_download — gators_download
code: gators_download(   synonyms_list,   newFileName,   gbif_match = "fuzzy",   idigbio_filter = TRUE )

title: gators_download — gators_download
text: synonyms_list list synonyms desired species. example, `synonyms_list = c("Asclepias curtissii","Asclepias aceratoides", "Asclepias arenicola", "Oxypteryx arenicola", "Oxypteryx curtissii")`. parameter required. newFileName path file name retrieved data. Note parameter include ".csv" extension well. example, `newFileName = "base_folder/other_folder/my_file.csv"`. file path can entered either relative current working directory (example: "../my_file.csv") full path. parameter required. gbif_match parameter select either search fuzzy matching scientific name search species code. example, `gbif_match = "fuzzy"` search fuzzy match `gbif_match = "code"` search code. parameter required assigned "fuzzy" default. idigbio_filter parameter remove less relevant search results iDigBio. Based search input, results may include data points different species mention desired species locality information, example. Choosing `idigbio_filter = TRUE` return data frame rows name column fuzzy matches name synonym list. parameter required assigned TRUE default.

title: gators_download — gators_download
text: Writes csv file specified input. csv file contain search results desired species GBIF iDigBio databases.

title: gators_download — gators_download
text: function uses getidigbio, getgbif, fix_columns, fix_names, filter_fix_names functions. function requires packages base, magrittr, utils, rgbif, dplyr, ridigbio, stringr.

title: gators_download — gators_download
code: gators_download(c("Asclepias curtissi","Asclepias aceratoides"), "newFile.csv", gbif_match = "code") #> Error in dplyr::bind_rows(temp, query_gbif): Argument 2 must be a data frame or a named atomic vector. gators_download(c("Asclepias curtissi","Asclepias aceratoides"), "my_new_file.csv", idigbio_filter = FALSE) #> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, "locality", value = "Locality:  "): replacement has 1 row, data has 0
